job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Great teamwork when you have a great staff for the day.
cons: Not much for a cafeteria, the coffee shop doesn't open until way after your shift has started. Management is not the best, poor staffing. Management listens to concerns, say they will fix things and they do not. This includes fixing broken items on the units. No time and a half for holidays, no yearly pay increases/increases for work achieved or advancement in skill set. Travel nurses are taking over and are not able to follow policies resulting in patient errors/delays however, we keep hiring travelers to fix the short staffing issue instead of paying regular staff retention pay.

pros: Good Pay, Good Work/Life Balance, Good People

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Saint Augustine, FL

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: local employment.  Many of bedside staff are still able to deliver good patient care in increasingly hostile work environment & do sincerely care about patient well being.
cons: Lowest pay scale for N.E. Fla hospitals.  Scant opportunity for salary increase or advancement.   Many in management positions due to favoritisim, not qualification or skill.  Unbelievable amount of brown-nosing and cliques.  Nurse/patient ratios & PCT/patient ratios are inadequate and often unsafe.  Bedside staff is not able to take a meal break without taking the companion phone along & can't leave your area to get food. The hospital  automatically takes a 30 minute meal break out of staff pay every day.  It is a bad idea to request reimbursement for a meal break you are unable to take. There is no one to cover patients for meal breaks.  If a patient complains you will be fired.  If a Dr. is rude or aggressive to staff & you complain you will be fired. And........beware of the "No rehire list".  It is very long and easy to become a member of.   Flagler does eliminate older and long term employees.  Work at Mayo instead. It is worth the drive.

job_title: Mail Room Technician in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Friendly atmosphere flexible hours opportunity to advance
cons: I wish i lived closer

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Got paid on time for working
cons: Rate of pay not competitive

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Great coworkers and team atmosphere, digital equipment, approachable physicians,
cons: cafeteria not open 24 hours

job_title: RN, Bsn in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Great place to work at
cons: no cons for Flagler hospital

review_title: Need to be more nurse friendly
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Beautiful hospital with good equipment, mostly private rooms
cons: Leadership does not listen to front line staff

job_title: Systems Administrator in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: The radiology department was very fun to work for and with lots of good technicians. The ground level IT workers and the NICU works are some very good people.
cons:
Super high turnover rate in the IT department due to horrible management particularly in the applications department. If you are not a woman do not expect a promotion in IT.
The cardiology department is just as bad.
the doctors in the NICU are even worse.  When an IT guys has to tell a Docotor to do their job there is a MAJOR problem.

You tell them that things are not going to work, they do not listen,  then they blame you when things don't go right for their lack of decision-making and responsibility to do the right thing.
They hired lots of people they do not know what they're doing will have no experience in their current roles. Like a previous review said the good old boys club here is firmly in place, it does not matter how much you mess up if you're part of the good old boys club you're golden.

job_title: Technician in Saint Augustine, FL
pros:
- Good place to get into the healthcare industry
- Great people to work
- Some perks of knowing the people when you have to visit the hospital
- The new CEO is trying to make improvements
- If you have a Masters Degree you are in management
cons:
- Few innovations and anything you might have heard of is rushed to give that illusion then abandoned.
- Never become valuable to the company because you will never move up
- No raises at all to get a raise you need to move jobs and if you are to valuable to be moved just leave.
- Even though the CEO is making improvements he is still surrounded by the people who will make the company go no where.
- Severely understaffed to the point its making workers leave from doing to many jobs.
- No one trusts their vision from what is being done, a lot of bad reckless decisions.
- High Employee turn over, there is no reason to stay.
- If you have a spouse just piggy back on their insurance, it will save you money.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: New nurses will find a talented team available for training and decent pay. The hospital will float you through many different specialties on different floors which will give you greater exposure to different types of patients.
cons: Pay raises are not east to come by no matter how well you perform. The higher starting pay quickly falls behind the advancement rate at other hospitals in the area. The leadership positions are well sewn up by long term employees so breaking in to management is very difficult.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: At first, company seems to care about it's employees and seems family oriented.
cons: What "seems" isn't always reality and certainly isn't in the case of Flagler Hospital. Good ole boy (or mostly in this employer's case, Good Ole Girl clearly describes the environment. People are clearly shown preferential treatment if they are in the "in" group. For example, the same employees can not show up for work repeatedly and barely even be given a warning while another employee who has good performance appraisals is let go after only been absent from work 1x. Some persons just because they may cozy up to that department manager, are given special schedules while others not so cozy just have to suck it up. Honestly, just not professionally run and would be concerned about a family member staying there for this reason.

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Working in St. Augustine is a dream. So much to do, never a dull moment. Affordable with great schools. Flagler is a community hospital with a community board and a community based mission. A very mission driven organization Flagler staff flat out get it done and embrace each other on the road to the community mission.
cons: Flagler is a stand alone hospital, the last of a dying breed. The futures in healthcare is changing which will require Flagler to create a new partnership down the road. How this will impact the organization going forward remains to be seen.

job_title: Patient Transport in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: A very professional staff there. Lots of encouragement and opportunities for further training and education. Great Facility
cons: Sometimes the corporate or business aspect of this Health Care Facility interferes with the excellent service people have come to expect The upper management tends to forget it is the patient is who we work for and not the bottom line accountants or insurance companies

job_title: Pct in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Working Float Pool PRN, is good because of the hours. Night shift pays extra with your base pay which adds up to 18 an hour.
cons: The bad side is Flagler is a small hospital with some of the worst nurses with terrible bedside manners, and bad attitudes towards the Patient Care Tech's.

review_title: Fun people to work with, typical hospital lifestyle.
job_title: Admission Representative in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Enjoyed all the people I worked with.
cons: Felt micro managed by upper management. Was clearly ready for promottion, but "seniority" beat me out . Person promoted was not ready for it.

review_title: was going to work here but not now
job_title: Service in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: nice location.  Beach was not nice.
cons: not working where upper management is not respected and not doing a good job....hate the good ol boy and girl stuff.

review_title: Best place I have worked as a nurse so far
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Laid back environment and they actually listen to their employees. Encourage employees to get involved. They do care about their employees
cons: HR acts annoyed if you ever need anything. Parking is a walk and hard to catch the bus. Insurance is bad right now but they are working on it

job_title: Rrt in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Was a wonderful job for 34 years but they are currently getting rid of employees who have been there a long time, to employ a new younger group of people with no experience.
cons: working with supervisors who tell every other employees business is not the kind of place I want to work for.

job_title: IS Analyst in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Great co workers, family friendly
cons: Senior management to mid management are the worse here.  Strong nepotism, unequal rights for employees, unethical practice of religion in the business place.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Awesome management, staff are encouraging and supportive. Everyone I worked with in the OR was amazing. If you are thinking of applying, I recommend it.
cons: Salary was below FL average for my job title.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Close proximity to home and that is about it.
cons: Pay is below average for the "richest" county in Florida, does not meet cost of living in St. Johns County. Poorer counties have better pay. New uncomfortable, and itchy "uniforms".

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Friendly employees to work with
cons:
Very low pay, expensive bad insurance, terrible management, especially in the accounting office, clicky management in admin and accounting office! When employees quit, they don’t replace them, and put more work on the rest of the department. 
No raises, but new CEO had a $4000 painting bought for his office! But he says they can’t afford raises!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Close to home, nice location
cons: Where do I begin? No raises for nurses, ever! They keep losing qualified nurses to other hospitals due to lack of respect and low pay. Employees voice concerns to management for years with no results.

job_title: Critical Care RN in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Close to home. No commute.
cons: Payscale. Recent layoffs and realignment of job titles, meaning many people lost their jobs or were demoted. Not staff oriented. Everyone out for themselves. Dog and pony show...

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: The staff is very welcoming, is a great place to learn
cons: can be a little bit like "high school." The hospital is small and gossip travels. Be cognizant of who you talk to.

Super high turnover rate in the IT department due to horrible management particularly in the applications department. If you are not a woman do not expect a promotion in IT.
The cardiology department is just as bad.
the doctors in the NICU are even worse.  When an IT guys has to tell a Docotor to do their job there is a MAJOR problem.

You tell them that things are not going to work, they do not listen,  then they blame you when things don't go right for their lack of decision-making and responsibility to do the right thing.
They hired lots of people they do not know what they're doing will have no experience in their current roles. Like a previous review said the good old boys club here is firmly in place, it does not matter how much you mess up if you're part of the good old boys club you're golden.

job_title: Technician in Saint Augustine, FL
pros:
- Good place to get into the healthcare industry
- Great people to work
- Some perks of knowing the people when you have to visit the hospital
- The new CEO is trying to make improvements
- If you have a Masters Degree you are in management
cons:
- Few innovations and anything you might have heard of is rushed to give that illusion then abandoned.
- Never become valuable to the company because you will never move up
- No raises at all to get a raise you need to move jobs and if you are to valuable to be moved just leave.
- Even though the CEO is making improvements he is still surrounded by the people who will make the company go no where.
- Severely understaffed to the point its making workers leave from doing to many jobs.
- No one trusts their vision from what is being done, a lot of bad reckless decisions.
- High Employee turn over, there is no reason to stay.
- If you have a spouse just piggy back on their insurance, it will save you money.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: New nurses will find a talented team available for training and decent pay. The hospital will float you through many different specialties on different floors which will give you greater exposure to different types of patients.
cons: Pay raises are not east to come by no matter how well you perform. The higher starting pay quickly falls behind the advancement rate at other hospitals in the area. The leadership positions are well sewn up by long term employees so breaking in to management is very difficult.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: At first, company seems to care about it's employees and seems family oriented.
cons: What "seems" isn't always reality and certainly isn't in the case of Flagler Hospital. Good ole boy (or mostly in this employer's case, Good Ole Girl clearly describes the environment. People are clearly shown preferential treatment if they are in the "in" group. For example, the same employees can not show up for work repeatedly and barely even be given a warning while another employee who has good performance appraisals is let go after only been absent from work 1x. Some persons just because they may cozy up to that department manager, are given special schedules while others not so cozy just have to suck it up. Honestly, just not professionally run and would be concerned about a family member staying there for this reason.

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Working in St. Augustine is a dream. So much to do, never a dull moment. Affordable with great schools. Flagler is a community hospital with a community board and a community based mission. A very mission driven organization Flagler staff flat out get it done and embrace each other on the road to the community mission.
cons: Flagler is a stand alone hospital, the last of a dying breed. The futures in healthcare is changing which will require Flagler to create a new partnership down the road. How this will impact the organization going forward remains to be seen.

job_title: Patient Transport in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: A very professional staff there. Lots of encouragement and opportunities for further training and education. Great Facility
cons: Sometimes the corporate or business aspect of this Health Care Facility interferes with the excellent service people have come to expect The upper management tends to forget it is the patient is who we work for and not the bottom line accountants or insurance companies

job_title: Pct in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Working Float Pool PRN, is good because of the hours. Night shift pays extra with your base pay which adds up to 18 an hour.
cons: The bad side is Flagler is a small hospital with some of the worst nurses with terrible bedside manners, and bad attitudes towards the Patient Care Tech's.

review_title: Fun people to work with, typical hospital lifestyle.

cons: Felt micro managed by upper management. Was clearly ready for promottion, but "seniority" beat me out . Person promoted was not ready for it.

review_title: was going to work here but not now

review_title: Best place I have worked as a nurse so far

cons: working with supervisors who tell every other employees business is not the kind of place I want to work for.

cons: Senior management to mid management are the worse here.  Strong nepotism, unequal rights for employees, unethical practice of religion in the business place.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Awesome management, staff are encouraging and supportive. Everyone I worked with in the OR was amazing. If you are thinking of applying, I recommend it.
cons: Salary was below FL average for my job title.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Close proximity to home and that is about it.
cons: Pay is below average for the "richest" county in Florida, does not meet cost of living in St. Johns County. Poorer counties have better pay. New uncomfortable, and itchy "uniforms".

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Friendly employees to work with
cons:
Very low pay, expensive bad insurance, terrible management, especially in the accounting office, clicky management in admin and accounting office! When employees quit, they don’t replace them, and put more work on the rest of the department. 
No raises, but new CEO had a $4000 painting bought for his office! But he says they can’t afford raises!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Close to home, nice location
cons: Where do I begin? No raises for nurses, ever! They keep losing qualified nurses to other hospitals due to lack of respect and low pay. Employees voice concerns to management for years with no results.

job_title: Critical Care RN in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Close to home. No commute.
cons: Payscale. Recent layoffs and realignment of job titles, meaning many people lost their jobs or were demoted. Not staff oriented. Everyone out for themselves. Dog and pony show...
